Term.Name: Charity
Term.Definition: An organisation which is funded by donations and which provides some form of community service
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Chartered Body
Term.Definition: An independent body with a degree of public funding, but which does not come under the control of a government agency. This includes professional bodies (e.g. the bodies which control the membership of professions such as medicine and accountancy), independent commissions (such as the Commission for Racial Equality and the Arts Council), and public service broadcasters
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Civil Defence Organisation
Term.Definition: Police, fire brigade, ambulance service, coastguard and similar bodies
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Club / Society
Term.Definition: A group of people with a common shared aim or interest. Clubs and societies in this context usually refer to recreational and cultural pursuits as other interests may be covered by charities
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Consortium
Term.Definition: A group of organisations which band together for a specific purpose such as financing a project which is too large for any of them to back alone
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Co-operative
Term.Definition: An organisation where the workforce all jointly own the company and thus share in the decision making process and also receive a profit share
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Educational Establishment
Term.Definition: A school, college, university or other publicly recognised seat of learning
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Financial Institution
Term.Definition: An institution providing financial services such as saving and borrowing money. For example a bank
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Internal Department
Term.Definition: An internal department within any organisation
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: International Public Body
Term.Definition: Organisations which act with common consent across international boundaries. Examples include the United Nations and the European Union
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Judiciary
Term.Definition: Courts of law or their equivalent
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Limited Company
Term.Definition: A registered limited company bound by companies law in the country in which it is incorporated
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Local Authority
Term.Definition: A regional government body within a country. Note that some countries may have several layers of government
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Military Organisation
Term.Definition: The army, navy or air force of any country or one of its constituent parts
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Mutual Society
Term.Definition: A financial institution such as a mutual assurance society or building society that has no shareholders but is directly owned by its investors
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Partnership
Term.Definition: A legal partnership between two or more persons in which they take an equal risk and share of the profits from any joint venture
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Political Party
Term.Definition: A group of people with common political aims
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Religious Order
Term.Definition: A religious organisation. This could refer to the organisation of an entire religion, a sect within a religion, a grouping within a religious sect, or an the organisation controlling an individual place of worship
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Sole Trader
Term.Definition: An individual person who is registered to trade. Effectively, this is the position of many self-employed people
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Trade Unions
Term.Definition: An organisation which campaigns for the rights of workers employed by a particular employer or within a particular industry
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Government Department
Term.Definition: A department of a country's central government
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML
